concept.title: Text Data Format with Custom Delimiters

conbody.p: text data formatcustom delimiterscustom delimiterstext data formatBy default, the text data format creates records based on line breaks, creating a record for each line of text. You can configure origins to create records based on custom delimiters.

Use custom delimiters when the origin system uses delimiters to separate logical sections of data that you want to use as records. A custom delimiter might be a simple as a semicolon or might be a set of characters. You can even use an XML tag to read XML data.

p.note: When using a custom delimiter, the origin uses the delimiter characters to create records, ignoring new lines.

conbody.p: You can include the custom delimiters in records or you can remove them.

For example, say you configure the Directory origin to process a file with the following text, using a semicolon as a delimiter:8/12/2016 6:01:00 unspecified error message;8/12/2016 6:01:04 another error message;8/12/2016 6:01:09 just a warning message;

If you configure Directory to discard the custom delimiter, the origin generates the following records:8/12/2016 6:01:00 unspecified error message 8/12/2016 6:01:04 another error message 8/12/2016 6:01:09 just a warning message
Note that the origin ignores the line break because it uses the semicolon custom delimiter to create records.
